summary: Email correspondence between a prosecutor from the Southern District of New York and Patricia Anne Pileggi regarding the service of a trial subpoena to Mar-a-Lago for employment records. The emails discuss identifying appropriate legal contacts at the Trump Organization and difficulties in locating records or personnel from the year 2000.

persons.name: Patricia Anne Pileggi
persons.role: Legal contact/representative for the Trump Organization/Mar-a-Lago
persons.context: Communicates with federal prosecutors regarding the service of a subpoena to Mar-a-Lago, acts as an intermediary for the Trump Organization's compliance counsel.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.role: Prosecutor, Southern District of New York
persons.context: Seeks to serve a trial subpoena on Mar-a-Lago for a records custodian and employment records, specifically inquiring about records from 2000.

connections.description: Engaged in professional correspondence regarding the legal process of serving a subpoena to Mar-a-Lago, with Pileggi acting as the intermediary for the Trump Organization.

connections.person2: Compliance Counsel for the Trump Organization
connections.description: Pileggi states she has been speaking with and receiving advice from the Trump Organization's Compliance Counsel regarding the subpoena and legal contacts for Mar-a-Lago.

events.title: Trial Subpoena Served on Mar-a-Lago
events.description: A trial subpoena is attached to an email and served, targeting Mar-a-Lago for a records custodian and employment records.

events.title: Reference to Mar-a-Lago Employment in 2000
events.description: The prosecutor is seeking employment records from Mar-a-Lago related to the year 2000. Pileggi reports an inability to locate anyone who recalls working there at that time.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York served a trial subpoena on Mar-a-Lago in October 2021, seeking employment records.
The subpoena specifically sought records related to a 'records custodian' and employment records, with an apparent interest in the year 2000.
Patricia Anne Pileggi acted as the intermediary, communicating that Mar-a-Lago did not have in-house counsel and that various Trump Organization attorneys handled its matters.
Pileggi reported that a provided document did not appear to be a regular business record and that she could not locate anyone who recalled working at Mar-a-Lago in 2000.
The correspondence indicates an ongoing investigation or legal proceeding in late 2021 where Mar-a-Lago's employment records from two decades prior were relevant.
